question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing itching all over my body for the past year.
Have you noticed any visible changes on your skin, like rashes or bumps?
Yes, I have linear urticaria on my upper back that appears after gentle scratching.
Does the itchiness worsen at night or after coming into contact with certain substances?
The itchiness gets worse around areas where tight clothing contacts my skin.
Do you have a history of allergies, asthma, or eczema, either personally or in your family?
I don't have any history of skin conditions.
Have you started using any new medications, soaps, detergents, or lotions before these symptoms began?
No, I haven't started using any new medications, soaps, detergents, or lotions before these symptoms began.
Are other members of your family experiencing similar symptoms?
No, other members of my family are not experiencing similar symptoms.
Final Diagnosis: Dermatographic urticaria.
